title: Beginner's Guide to Community-Based Arts , 1st Editon OUT OF STOCK: Ten Graphic Stories about Artists, Educators & Activists Across the U.S.
description: Ten transformative local arts projects come alive in this illustrated training manual for youth leaders and teachers. This energetic guidebook demonstrates the enormous power of art in grass-roots social change. It presents proven models of community-based arts programs, plus techniques, discussion questions, and plentiful resources.Writer MatSchwarzman directs the Crossroads Center at Xavier University, which trains youth leaders nationwide in community-based arts activism. He holds a PhD in transformative learning.Graphic storyteller Keith Knight is an award-winning cartoonist, rapper, and hip-hop musician with three nationally syndicated comic strips
author: Mat Schwarzman
